name: treatment of slaughterhouse waste, rendering | meat and bone meal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17635/documentation

This dataset represents a rendering plan, treating slaughterhouse waste to tallow and meat and bone meal. The original dataset was physically allocated to the tallow. Since the process of meat and bone meal production is nearly the same as the production of tallow (all steps are common except the milling of the meal), the original allocated inventory was adjusted to the total amount of product output. 

From reception of slaughterhouse waste at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the produced tallow and meat and bone meal. An important emission from rendering is foul odour, which is not quantified in this datset. No indications of other relevant air emissions were found, so no air emissions  were added. There were no data available on waste generation.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Based on data from the year 1999.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Values refer to the situation in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Refers to a typical technology for tallow processing in Switzerland. The tallow-production process is described as follows: The animal carcasses and abattoir wastes are crushed in a grinder, then sterilised by steam. They are then dried using steam as a heat source, and finally defatted, a process in which the fat is separated from the greaves. The fat is clarified, while the greaves are milled into meat- and bone meal. The processing paths of tallow and of meat- and bone meal are very similar, diverging only in the final step (milling). The minimum requirements for sterilisation are a temperature of 133 °C and a pressure of 3 bar for 20 minutes (Nottrodt 2001). ;References;Kleinhanss W., Uhlmann F. & Haxsen G. (2000) Folgenabschätzung alternativer Entsorgungsverfahren für Tierkörper und Schlachtabfälle bei einem Verwendungsverbot zur Futtermittelherstellung, 13p. Retrieved on July 11, 2002 from http://www.bal.fal.de/download/Fe_tmverbot.pdf. ;Nottrodt A. (2001) Technische Anforderungen und allgemeine Empfehlungen für die Entsorgung von Tiermehl und Tierfett in Verbrennungsanlagen - Bericht erstellt im Auftrag des Bundesministeriums für Umwelt, Naturschutz und Reaktorsicherheit, 63p. Retrieved on July 11, 2002 from http://www.bmu.de/download/dateien/leitf.pdf.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data come from one rendering plant in Switzerland.

exchanges.description: Estimation. The collected data refer to the total production of meat meal, bone meal and tallow in the rendering plant. Assuming 40% dry matter and 40% extractable fat in dry matter of slaughterhouse waste, therefore 60% dry matter meat and bone meal. Calculation adjusts the percentages to wet mass.
